items.title: Some Patterns of Duplications in the outputs of Mersenne Twister Pseudorandom Number Generator MT19937
items.authors: Alain Schumacher, Takuji Nishimura, Makoto Matsumoto
items.institution: SICAP R&D, Yamagata University, AMAGAERU Institute of Free Mathematics
items.contributions: 1. Identified a new statistical failure in the widely-used MT19937 PRNG using a natural run-length distribution test. 2. Provided a mathematical theorem explaining the observed anomalies, linking them to the sparseness of a specific matrix in the generator's recursion. 3. Demonstrated that while the defect is theoretically significant, detecting it in practice requires an astronomical number of samples, thus assessing its practical severity.
items.summary: This paper reports a new statistical flaw in the Mersenne Twister MT19937 pseudorandom number generator, where the distribution of run-lengths for identical 32-bit integers shows a significant anomaly (e.g., run-length 623 appears ~40 times more than expected). The authors mathematically analyze and prove that this failure is caused by the sparseness of a specific matrix in the generator's recurrence. They conclude that while this is a theoretical defect, its practical impact is minimal due to the extreme difficulty of detection.
